SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that a Joint Venture Agreement has been signed on November 24, 2010 between NTPC Limited (NTPC), Asian Development Bank (ADB) and Kyuden International Corporation (Kyushu) to form a Joint Venture Company (JVC) in NCT of Delhi to develop projects and establish over a period of three years a portfolio of about 500 MW of Renewable Power Generation in India. Initially, JVC shall primarily develop wind power and small hydroelectric power projects and in future may also develop other renewable power generation resources. The JVC may develop projects outside India in Developing Member Countries only. NTPC, ADB and Kyushu shall contribute in the ratio 50:25:25 in the equity share capital of the Company. The initial authorised share capital of the Company would be Rs 6.5 Crore and the paid-up share capital would be Rs.1 crore.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of NTPC, in its meeting held on November 12, 2010, has accorded investment approval for Pakri Barwadih Coal Mining Project (15 Million Tonnes Per Annum) at current estimated cost as of 1st Quarter 2010 price level of Rs.3193.86 crore (including Interest During Construction, Financing Charges and Working Capital Margin). Pakri Barwadih coal block is located in Hazaribagh district of Jharkhand State. This coal block was allotted to NTPC on October 11, 2004. Key activities like approval of mining plan, Rehabilitation Action Plan, arrangements for power supply, notifications for land acquisitions under CBA Act have been completed. The activities like payment disbursement for land, CHP award etc are in progress. The Mine would likely to start production during 2012.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that : "An MOU has been signed today i.e. August 30, 2010 between NTPC Limited and Bangladesh Power Development Board (BPDB) on mutual co-operation between the parties for development of Power Sector in Bangladesh. NTPC may set up a 1320 MW coal based power plant in Bangladesh in joint venture with BPDB, subject to techno economic viability, for mitigating the power shortage of Bangladesh. NTPC will also provide training & development to human resources of BPDB and enhancement of productivity and efficiency of their existing power stations".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that NTPC has prepared its Long Term Corporate Plan to set the goals and targets for the period up to 2032. The Corporate Plan has been approved and adopted by NTPC Board in its meeting held on June 21, 2010. NTPC has set for itself a target to have an installed power generating capacity of 1,28,000 MW by the year 2032. The capacity will have a diversified fuel mix comprising 56% coal, 16% gas, 11% nuclear and 17% renewables (including hydro). Therefore, by 2032 non-fossil fuel based generation capacity shall make up nearly 28% of NTPC's portfolio. However, it is clarified that the actual results may vary materially from those expressed or implied in the Corporate Plan due to risks or uncertainties associated therewith depending upon economic conditions, government policies and other incidental factors.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that Government of India, Deptt. of Public Enterprises, Ministry of Heavy Industries & Public Enterprises vide Office Memorandum dated May 19, 2010 has conveyed grant of Maharatna status to NTPC apart from three other Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSES). Since, presently NTPC has requisite number of non-official Directors on its Board, therefore, only NTPC is eligible to exercise delegated Maharatna powers. Consequent upon grant of Maharatna status, the Board of Directors of NTPC shall be, inter-alia, empowered to make equity Investment to establish financial joint ventures and wholly-owned subsidiaries and undertake mergers & acquisitions, in India or abroad, subject to a ceiling of 15% of the net worth, limited to Rs. 5000 crore in one project as against earlier limit of Rs. 1000 crore. The exercise of Maharatna powers would be subject to the same conditions and guidelines as laid down by the Government in respect of Navratna CPSEs from time to time.

SUBJECT: Updates

The Company has been formed to carry on the business of acquisition in part or full, of green field or operational Coal/Lignite mine blocks in India and abroad and development of all kinds of Coal/Lignite mining for supply of fuels to the Company, NTPC and other buyers".

SUBJECT: Joint Venture
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "A Joint Venture Agreement has been executed on 27.04.2010 between NTPC Limited and Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited (NPCIL) for formation of a Public Limited Company to set up nuclear power project with two nuclear reactor units which may be extended to setting-up additional Nuclear Power Projects subject to techno-economic viability. The proposed Joint Venture Company (JVC) will be a subsidiary of NPCIL in which NPCIL shall hold 51% equity and the balance 49% will be held by NTPC Ltd. The core benefit of nuclear power is that it is a reliable, safe and green source of energy and is also seen as an alternative solution to the issues of global warming as well as the rising fuel security crisis".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that "To give fillip to its large capacity addition programme, a Project Monitoring Centre (PMC) has been setup by NTPC. PMC was inaugurated by Hon'ble Union Minister of Power, Shri Sushil Kumar Shinde, on March 24, 2010. Shri H. S. Brahma, Secretary (Power), Govt. of India, Shri R. S. Sharma, CMD, NTPC and other senior officials from Ministry of Power and NTPC were present on the occasion. This PMC has facility of video-wall for facilitating video conferencing with all Projects and Web based Project Monitoring with respect to schedule by leveraging state of art IT tool. All the ongoing projects and all future identified new projects are connected to the PMC and Web based monitoring has been rolled for all the ongoing projects".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: (1) Unit # 5 (490 MW) of National Capital Thermal Power Project, Dadri was synchronised with coal on 25.12.2009. This was the first unit planned to provide power to Common Wealth Games to be organised in Delhi in October 2010. (ii) The Board of Directors of NTPC, in its 345th meeting held on 29.12.2009, has accorded approval for the following: (a) A road map to foray into solar power generation business for capacity addition of 301 MW through solar energy by March 2014. Out of 301 MW,190 MW will be added through Solar Thermal technology and the balance 111 MW will be added through Solar PV technology. As a first Step, grid interactive 15 MW solar thermal based project is being taken up by NTPC at Anta in Rajasthan which is first of its kind in India. (b) Investment to undertake Renovation & Modernisation works of 2x210MW (UNIT # 4 and Unit # 5) Badarpur Thermal Power Station (705MW) at an estimated cost of Rs.564.53 Cr (including Taxes and Duties, Contingency, IDC and Financing Charges)".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: " (1) With respect to allocation of KG, D-6 Gas (2.67 MMSCMD) by Empowered Group of Ministers (EGoM) for NTPC's existing gas based power stations, various issues for signing of Gas Supply & Purchase Agreement (GSPA) with Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) have been resolved, except one for which NTPC intimated its position to RIL and the same was not acceptable to them. NTPC is further discussing with RIL for early resolution of the issue. It is informed that NTPC is committed to draw the allocated gas for its National Capital Region (NCR) gas based power Stations at Anta, Dadri and Faridabad, without prejudice to its rights and contentions in the ongoing suit between NTPC and RIL pending before the Hon'ble Bombay High Court for Kawas and Gandhar expansion projects. (2) Further, in response to some news items on 03-09-09 that "NTPC did not reciprocate on gas deal at $ 2.34 / MMBTU, says RIL", NTPC clarifies that the entire facts of the case are before the Hon'ble Bombay High Court and the matter is subjudice. Hence, NTPC does not want to comment on this".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that "A Memorandum of Understanding was signed on December 01, 2008 amongst NTPC Ltd., NHPC Ltd., Power Grid and DVC to form a Joint Venture Company to set up with equal equity participation an "Online High Power Test Laboratory" (OHPTL) for short circuit testing facility. Presently, manufacturers and utilities are sending their equipments to overseas testing labs which is not only time consuming but expensive too. The OHPTL facility will test power transformers, LT/HT Switchgears, bus-ducts, CTs etc".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "NTPC's Bond Issue (Series XXVIII) has received an overwhelming response. Against an issue size of Rs. 500 crore with Green Shoe option to retain over subscription, commitments over 3000 crore were received. The issue generated lot of interest among investors and generated a momentum thereby pulling down the yield for 10 year bonds to attractive levels of 11% annualized. As compared to other bonds of similar maturity, the yields are lower by 20-30 BPS. On the very first day of issue opening, subscription amount of Rs.1000 crores has been received. The Company has decided to pre-close the issue on earliest closing date i.e. 10th November, 2008 itself and also exercise the Green Shoe option to retain additional amount of Rs.500 crore. The Bonds shall be listed on the Wholesale Debt Market Segment of National Stock Exchange shortly. Investors have once again reposed their confidence in India's number one Power Generating Company. The Company has also raised Rs.350 crore against another Bond Issue (series XXVII) on 06.11.2008. These Bonds were placed with NTPC Ltd. Employees Provident Fund Trust and are not proposed to be listed".

DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that "The Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on January 30, 2008 have given the investment approval for Bogaigaon Thermal Power project (3 X 250 MW) in the state of Assam at an appraised estimated current cost of Rs.43,753.50 million."

SUBJECT: Interim Dividend
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "The Board of Directors in its meeting held on 30th January 2008 had decided, inter-alia, to pay interim dividend for the financial year 2007-08. The interim dividend shall be paid at the rate of 27% on the face value of paid-up equity shares of Rs.10/- each".

SUBJECT: Standalone Results Update, Quarter ended, 31-DEC-2007
DETAILS: NTPC Limited has informed the Exchange regarding the standalone Results for the quarter ended on 31-DEC-2007 as follows: Net Sales of Rs. 933080 lacs for quarter ending on 31-DEC-2007 against Rs. 814680 lacs for the quarter ending on 31-DEC-2006. Net Profit / (Loss) of Rs. 177990 lacs for the quarter ending on 31-DEC-2007 against Rs. 210330 lacs for the quarter ending on 31-DEC-2006.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "Pursuant to signing of MOU with Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd., (BHEL) on 10/09/2007, and signing of a Joint Venture Agreement on 17/12/2007, NTPC Ltd has signed with BHEL Ltd a supplementary Agreement on 11/01/2008 to engage in manufacturing and supply of equipment for power plants and other infrastructure projects in India and Abroad. NTPC Ltd and BHEL shall have an equal equity participation in this Joint Venture".

SUBJECT: Signing of agreement
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "NTPC Ltd. has signed a loan Agreement of Rs. 1000 crores alongwith a Bond Subscription Agreement of Rs. 1000 crores with Life Insurance Corporation of India on December 26, 2007 to finance Capital Expenditure of its power generation projects, Coal Mining business, Renovation and Modernization activity and LNG business. The door-to- door maturity of both the agreements is 11 years, the repayments to take place in 14 half yearly installments commencing after 4 years. The interest rate/coupon is linked to 10 year G-sec Rate plus margin. The proceeds under these Agreements are to be utilized before end of March?2008".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that "NTPC concluded a USD 380 million loan facility under the Japan Bank International Co-operation (JBIC) guarantee to part finance the 1980 MW (3 X 660 MW) Barh Super Thermal Power Project (Stage I) in Bihar state. The Loan agreement was signed on 20th December 2007 at Tokyo. The facility will have floating rate of interest linked to the LIBOR and door to door maturity of 18 years. This is the first facility extended by JBIC without Sovereign Guarantee".

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "The Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on November 26, 2007 have: (1) Given the investment approval for Mauda thermal Power project (2 X 500 MW) in the state of Maharashtra at an appraised estimated current cost of Rs.54,592.79 million. (2) Given the investment approval to undertake Renovation and Modernisation works at Kawas Gas Power Station (645 MW) in the state of Gujarat at an estimated cost of Rs. 5974.90 Million. (3) Approved the NTPC's equity investment in Bhartiya Rail Bijlee Company Limited (a subsidiary of NTPC) upto Rs. 11882.60 million (equivalent to 74% of equity contribution) to enable it to implement 4 X 250MW nabinagar Thermal Power Project in the state of Bihar, subject to prior proportionate equity contribution by Railways."

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited had informed the Exchange that: 'NTPC Limited has formed a subsidiary Company under the name and style of 'Bhartiya Rail Bijlee Company Limited' today i.e. on November 22, 2007 for setting up a captive power plant of 1000 MW (2X250MW) at Nabinagar, Bihar. NTPC shall contribute 74% equity and the balance 26% equity in the share capital of this Company shall be extended by Ministry of Railways, Government of India."

SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "NTPC Limited and Uttar Pradesh Rajya Vidyut Utpadan Nigam Limited (UPRVUNL) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding on November 22, 2007 for the formation of a Joint Venture Company (JVC) for establishing and operating 2X660 MW coal based thermal power project at Meja Tehsil or any other suitable site in Allahabad district in the state of Uttar Pradesh subject to establishment of techno-commercial viability and other clearances. JVC shall he formed with equal equity participation from NTPC and UPRVUNL."

SUBJECT: Signing of agreement
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "NTPC Limited and the Ministry of Railways have signed an agreement on November 6, 2007 for the formation of a Joint Venture Company namely "Bhartiya Rail Bijlee Company Limited" for setting up a captive power plant of 1000 MW(4X250 MW) at Nabinagar, Bihar. NTPC will contribute 74% of equity and the balance 26% equity shall be extended by Railways. The Company will be a subsidiary of NTPC. 90% of the power from the plant will be supplied to Railways and 10% to others".

The MOU also provides for jointly undertaking further research work in collaborative manner with equal participation from NTPC and HWB for enhancing efficacy of AFGC Technology".

(a joint venture between NTPC Limited and BSEB) by setting up two units of 250 MW each in addition to existing 220 MW capacity under renovation at Muzzaffarpur in the state of Bihar".

SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that "NTPC Limited has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Government of Bihar and The Bihar State Electricity Board (BSEB) on October 14, 2007 to promote a Joint Venture Company with the aim of establishing and operating a 3X660 MW coal based Thermal Power Project at Nabinagar site in Aurangabad district in the State of Bihar. The joint venture shall have equal participation between NTPC and BSEB with power allocation to BSEB upto 75%. The balance power shall be with NTPC for supply to other States".

The Joint Venture Company shall be jointly owned by NTPC and BHEL on the basis of 50:50 equity participation".

I dated 30th August , 2007 of the Ministry of Power, Government of India and in pursuance of Article 41 of the Articles of Association of NTPC Limited, the President has appointed Shri V.P. Joy, Joint Secretary, Ministry of Power as Part- time Director (Government nominee) on the Board of NTPC Limited, with effect from August 30, 2007."

DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that "NTPC Limited has signed an Memorandum of Understanding on August 31, 2007 with Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL), Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Limited (RINL), Coal India Limited (CIL) and National Mineral Development Corporation Limited (NMDC) for formation of a Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) for securing thermal coal from outside India. Under this SPV, the parties shall cooperate to create project and/or country specific Joint Venture Company (ies) which may also involve equity participation".

Further, the dividend on equity shares, as recommended by the Board of Directors, subject to the provisions of section 206A of the Companies Act, 1956, if declared at the Annual General Meeting, will be paid on or after September 17, 2007.

The share of reserves is indicated as 354 Million Tonnes".

SUBJECT: Cessation of Directorship
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that : " As per order dated 31st July, 2007 of the Ministry of Power, Government of India, on attaining the age of superannuation, Shri Harish Chandra, Principal Adviser in the Ministry of Power ceases to be in Government Service with effect from the afternoon of the 31st July, 2007. Accordingly in line with Article 41 (iv) of the Articles of Association of NTPC Limited, Shri Harish Chandra also ceased to be Director on the Board of NTPC Limited w.e.f. 31st July 2007 (A/N)".

SUBJECT: Joint Venture

SUBJECT: Standalone Results Update, Quarter ended, 30-JUN-2007
DETAILS: NTPC Limited has informed the Exchange regarding the standalone Results for the quarter ended on 30-JUN-2007 as follows: Net Sales of Rs. 896970 lacs for quarter ending on 30-JUN-2007 against Rs. 715360 lacs for the quarter ending on 30-JUN-2006. Net Profit / (Loss) of Rs. 236990 lacs for the quarter ending on 30-JUN-2007 against Rs. 155280 lacs for the quarter ending on 30-JUN-2006.

SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "A Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) has been signed on 29th July 2007 between NTPC and Anna University, Chennai (AUC) to provide a platform for knowledge sharing and collaboration to promote Research and Development. As per MOU, NTPC and AUC would co-operate and promote Research & Development in the area of mutual interest, continue education program conducted by AUC in mutually identified areas of interest and establish a 'NTPC Center of Excellence in Energy Studies'".

SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "A Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) has been signed on 27th July, 2007 between NTPC and Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Ltd. (RINL) to form a joint venture company (JVC) for setting-up Blast Furnace Gas based Gas turbine combined cycle power plant of about 150 MW capacity in Vishakapatnam.  The power required by RINL shall be made available by JVC at the bus-Bar of the project for off-take by RINL. However, JVC shall have the right to supply surplus power, if available, to other bulk consumers in consultation with RINL at rates to be agreed upon".

SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "A Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) has been signed on 26th July 2007 between NTPC and Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) for development of "Automated Boiler Tube Inspection system in coal based thermal power plants". The collaboration will be of great utility to NTPC for competency building in new technology development for inspection of boiler tubes. The MOU also provides for future multiplication of such systems for which all necessary help will be extended by BARC".

SUBJECT: Appointment
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that "As per order No. 8/6/2007-TH.I dated 23rd July, 2007 of the Ministry of Power, Government of India and in pursuance of Article 41 of the Articles of Association of NTPC Limited, the President has appointed Shri Rajesh Verma, Joint Secretary and Financial Advisor, Ministry of Power as Part-time Director (Government nominee) on the Board of NTPC Limited, with effect from 23rd July, 2007 vice Shri M.Sahoo, former Joint Secretary & Financial Advisor, Ministry of Power  who ceased to be Director, NTPC w.e.f. 29th June, 2007".

SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange on July 23, 2007, that: "A Memorandum of Understanding was signed today between NTPC Ltd., and Asian Development Bank (ADB), a multilateral Development Financial Institution to establish a Private Limited Company in joint venture initially among NTPC and other strategic investors with equity shareholding of upto 50% by NTPC (and other government entities) and balance equity share holding contributed by other strategic investors. Strategic investors shall be selected by NTPC Ltd., and ADB. After fulfillment of certain conditions, ADB is expected to acquire 20% stake at a later stage. The Company shall be a generating Company and over the next three years, will establish and hold a portfolio of about 500 MW of renewable generation. Initially the business will primarily concentrate on wind power, mini and micro hydroelectric power projects, but the portfolio may also include other renewable power generation resources such as industrial cogeneration, waste-to-energy, solar, geothermal, bio mass and bio fuel projects. The Company would also have a regional and later global outlook as a major investor and facilitator of renewable energy.  For the first 15 years after formation of the Company, the Chairman of the Board shall be a Director nominated by NTPC Ltd.".

SUBJECT: Commencement of commercial operation
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "The 500 MW Unit- II at Vindhyachal Super Thermal Power Project, Stage-III will commence commercial operation from 15th July 2007. With the commercial operation of this unit, the total installed and commercial capacity of Vindhyachal Super Thermal Power Project would be 3260 MW".

SUBJECT: Investment
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "The Board of Directors of the Company, in its Meeting held recently, has approved the proposal to invest NTPC's equity in Aravali Power Company Private Limited (a Joint Venture of NTPC Limited, Indraprastha Power Generation Corporation Limited and Haryana Power Generation Corporation Limited) up to Rs. 10000 Million (including equity contribution already made by NTPC) to enable it to implement 1500 MW Aravali Super Thermal Power Project, Jhajjar"

SUBJECT: Cessation of Directorship
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that : "As per order dated 3rd July, 2007 of the Ministry of Power, Government of India, on completion of the tenure of his Central Deputation, Shri M. Sahoo, stands relieved of his duties as Joint Secretary & Financial Advisor in the Ministry of Power with effect from the afternoon of the 29th June, 2007. Accordingly in line with Article 41 (iv) of the Articles of Association of NTPC  Limited, Shri M. Sahoo also ceased to be Director on the Board of NTPC Limited w.e.f. from 29th June 2007 (A/N)".

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "NTPC Ltd., forges a dynamic alliance with Transformers and Electricals Kerala Ltd (TELK), a Government of Kerala Company with proven expertise of over four decades in the business of manufacture, marketing and servicing of Power Transformers, Current Voltage Transformers, Circuit Breakers, Isolated Phase Bus Ducts, Shunt Reactors etc., in a strategic step towards making NTPC an integrated power major. The Company has decided to enter into a Business Collaboration and Shareholders' agreement with TELK and the Government of Kerala for synergy in the field of manufacturing and repair of high voltage power transformers and associated equipment. As a result of this agreement, NTPC has agreed to acquire 44.6% stake in TELK from Government of Kerala and its undertakings presently holding 95.6% equity of TELK".

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports that NTPC Limited may announce a bonus issue. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. NTPC Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "Please be informed that the company is not contemplating any bonus issue."

SUBJECT: Final Dividend
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the company's at its meeting held on May 30, 2007 have recommended final dividend @8% of paid up equity share capital in addition to the interim dividend paid @24% of paid up equity share capital in February 2007.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that "A 500 MW unit of Sipat Super Thermal Power Project-stage II of NTPC Limited located in the state of Chattisgarh has been successfully test synchronized on 27th May 2007. This is the first unit that has been commissioned in respect of Sipat Super Thermal Power Project slated to have an ultimate capacity of 2980 MW. With the Commissioning of this unit, the total installed capacity of the Company has became 27904 MW"

SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "A Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) was signed between NTPC and Ministry of Energy, Federal Government of Nigeria (FGN) on May 22, 2007 at Abuja, Nigeria for energy co-operation. Under the MOU, FGN shall provide atleast 3 MTPA of LNG to NTPC on long-term basis at a reasonable price and encourage NTPC to participate in bidding for gas block. Upon successful operation of above obligation by FGN, NTPC shall set up and operate a 500 MW coal based power plant and a 700MW gas based power plant in Nigeria on its own or through a joint venture. NTPC shall also assist FGN in rehabilitation, renovation and modernization of its power stations and also help in developing and upgrading existing training facilities".

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has submitted to the Exchange a copy of special resolution passed on May 15, 2007 under Section 17 of the companies Act, 1956 for Alteration of the object clause of Memorandum of Association of the company by Postal Ballot. The details of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). SUBJECT: Results of Postal Ballot
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that "The Chairman & Managing Director of NTPC has declared the result of postal ballot conducted for passing of Special Resolution for amending existing clause 1 and Clause 4 (a) of the Memorandum of Association of the Company to enable the Company to take up nuclear power generation activities. The Special Resolution has been passed by 99.993% of the total valid votes cast in favour of the resolution."

SUBJECT: Joint Venture
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "Today i.e. 11th May, 2007, NTPC Limited and The Singareni Collieries Company Limited (SCCL) have signed a Joint Venture Agreement for creation of a Joint Venture Company to undertake various activities in coal and power sectors including acquisition of coal/lignite mine blocks, development and operation of integrated coal based power plants and providing consultancy services. In the proposed Joint Venture Company both NTPC and SCCL shall hold 50% equity each".

SUBJECT: Postal Ballot
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that pursuant to Section 192A of the Companies Act, 1956 read with the Companies (Passing of the Resolution by Postal Ballot) Rules, 2001, the consent of the shareholders is to be obtained for the following resolution: Special Resolution under section 17 of the Companies Act, 1956 for alteration of the Object Clause 1 and Clause 4(a) of the Main Objects of the Memorandum of Association of the Company. The Company has appointed Ms. Madhurima Mukherjee, Partner, M/s Luthra & Luthra, New Delhi as Scrutinizer for conducting the postal ballot process in a fair and transparent manner. The duly completed postal ballot form should reach the Scrutinizer on or before the close of working hours on May 05, 2007. The results of Postal Ballot will be declared by the Chairman & Managing Director on May 15, 2007. Further, a copy of the Postal Ballot Notice shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). For more details click here.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "A 500 MW unit of Kahalgaon Super Thermal Power Project - Stage II of NTPC Limited located in the state of Bihar has been successfully test synchronized on 31st March 2007. With the commissioning of this unit, the installed capacity of Kahalgaon Super Thermal Power project has become 1340 MW and the total installed capacity of the Company has become 27404 MW".

SUBJECT: Agreement
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "NTPC signed an agreement for a term loan of USD 100 million with KFW of Germany on March 23, 2007 at Frankfurt am Main. While previously KFW routed funding for NTPC projects through the Government of India, this is the first loan directly provided by them to NTPC. The loan is unsecured facility without sovereign guarantee bearing variable interest linked to LIBOR and with a door to door maturity of 10 years. The funds would be utilized to part finance the expenditure on Renovation and Modernization (R&M) of NTPC power plants".

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that: "The Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on March 23, 2007 has accorded investment approval for Simhadri Super Thermal Power Project - Stage - II having two units of 500 MW each. This project shall be an expansion of existing Simhadri Super Thermal Power project having a capacity of 1000 MW, which is presently under commercial operation".

SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that "NTPC Limited has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Coal India Limited on 15.03.2007 for undertaking development, operation & maintenance of coal blocks and integrated coal based power plants. The MOU will leverage both the Companies to pool in their experiences and expertise in the areas of coal mining and operation & maintenance of captive power plants using middlings of coal washeries and coal washeries rejects. The areas of immediate co-operation are development of two coal blocks Brahmini (1900 MT) and Chichro Patsimal (356 MT) in Jharkhand to be developed and operated as 50:50 joint venture between CIL and NTPC".

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited had informed the Exchange that: "A 500 MW unit of Vindhyachal Super Thermal Power Project - Stage III of NTPC Limited located in the state of Madhya Pradesh has been successfully synchronized in the night of 8th March 2007." With the commissioning of this unit, the installed capacity of Vindhyachal Super Thermal Power Project has become 3,260 MW (largest station in the country) and the total installed capacity owned by Company has become 26,904 MW".

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports that NTPC Limited may invest $ 500 million in Sri Lanka plant. Further, the company is mulling 500 MW power plant in Sri Lanka. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. NTPC Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "In this regard we wish to clarify that NTPC has been discussing with Government of Sri Lanka since the year 2005, a proposal for putting up of a power plant in that country. The proposal is still under discussion and the company is likely to sign a Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) with the Government of Sri Lanka shortly which shall be disclosed to the Stock Exchanges as per disclosure requirements."

SUBJECT: Investment
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that the BoDs of the Company at its meeting held on November 16, 2006 have given investment approval for the Tapovan Vishnugad Hydro Electric Power Project (4 X 130 MW) as a merchant power plant at an indicative estimated completed cost of Rs.34,250.30 million.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous

With the commissioning of this unit, the installed capacity of Feroze Gandhi Unchahar Thermal Power Project has become 1050 MW and the total installed capacity of the company including those owned through joint venture companies has become 26,404 MW.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that as the per the decision of the Govt. of India to take over Muzaffarpur Thermal Power Station (2x 110 MW) located in the state of Bihar, a joint venture company between NTPC Ltd and Bihar State Electricity Board (BSEB) has been incorporated on September 06, 2006 under the name and style of Vaishali Power Generating Company Ltd. NTPC shall initially hold 51% of equity capital and the balance equity shall be subscribed by BSEB / Govt. of Bihar. The Company is a Subsidiary of NTPC.

SUBJECT: AGM
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that the AGM is scheduled to be held on September 19,2006.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that Dr. Manmohan Singh, Hon'ble Prime Minister of India shall delicate the Talcher Super Thermal Power Station (3000MW) of NTPC Limited to the Nation on August 28,2006. The station situated in Orissa has six units of 500 MW each, all of which have already been commissioned making it the largest power station of the country.

SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that the Company has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Delhi Transco Ltd. for exploring the possibility of expanding its Badarpur Thermal Power Station (BTPS), New Delhi by adding 2 x 490 MW Units subject to environmental and other clearances. NTPC has also signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Haryana Power Generation Corporation Ltd. and Indraprastha Power Generation Co. Ltd. (A Govt. of NCT of Delhi Undertaking) to establish a 1500 MW Coal Based Power Plant in the State of Haryana, subject to establishment of techno-commercial feasibility and necessary clearances / approvals. The Plant shall be set up by NTPC on concept to commissioning basis for the exclusive use of Haryana and Delhi on long-term management contract of at least 25 years on terms to be decided.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous

Consequently, the targets for the XII Plan (2012-2017) have been revised and it is now estimated that the company would become a 75,000+ MW company instead of the earlier projected capacity of 66,000+ MW by the year 2017.

The Dividend on the equity shares, as recommended by the board of directors, subject to the provisions of section 206A of the Companies Act, 1956, if declared at the AGM, will be paid on or after September 22, 2006.

DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the company in its meeting held on June 26,2006 has : 1) Given investment approval for setting up of 4 X 150 MW hydro-electric power project at Loharinag-Pala as a merchant power plant at an indicative estimated completed cost of Rs.32829 million. 2) Given investment approval for construction of lift pump house of Farraka feeder canal as capital addition scheme at Farakka Super Thermal Power Station at an estimated cost of Rs.1284 million.

SUBJECT: Dividend
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held on May 31, 2006 have recommended final dividend @ 8% of paid up equity share capital in addition to the interim dividend paid @ 20% of paid up equity share capital in February 2006.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held on May 31, 2006 have approved the proposal to take-over Government of India owned Badarpur Thermal Power Station (BTPS) pursuant to the decision of the Government to transfer power business of BTPS to NTPC. Accordingly, w.e.f. June 01, 2006, BTPS shall be owned by NTPC and the installed capacity of the Company shall increase from current 23,935 MW to 24,640 MW.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited had informed the Exchange regarding an enhancement in its capacity addition plan for the period 2007-2012 (XI Plan) from 11,558 MW to 17,333 MW. It had also indicated a tentative list of projects included in the revised capacity addition program. The Company is considering to enhance the capacity of the on-going Barh Super thermal Power Project  by adding either 2 units of 660MW(1320MW) or 2 units of 800MW (1600MW). These additions would be within the overall capacity additions already announced.

SUBJECT: Reg.13-SEBI(Prohibition of Insider Trading Regulations)1992

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that Shri R.C. Shrivastav has taken over as Director (Human Resource) of the Company w.e.f. May 24,2006.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that a press release dated May 3, 2006, issued by the Press Information Bureau of the Government of India that the Union Cabinet on May 3, 2006 has given its approval for the following: Quote  (1) To birfurcate the balance sheet of Badarpur Thermal Power Station (BTPS) into two parts - one relating to power producing business and another as a residual asset holding unit and the latter will be retained by the Government of India as the owner till the decision on Settlement of DESU period dues is taken.(ii) To authorize transfer of power business of BTPS to NTPC at a total business value of Rs. 408 crores. NTPC will be given 100 days to pay the amount of Rs. 274 crores (excluding the value of liabilities of Rs. 134 crores from the total business of Rs.408 crore) from the date of transfer. These figures, however, are subject to actual verification on transfer date as BTPS is a running Company.(iii) To authorize lease of 517.08 hectors of land for a period of 50 years on which power plant of BTPS is located now to NTPC. NTPC will pay a lease rent of 10% of the book value of land i.e. Rs. 5.2 crores per year as lease rent. Government reserves the right to review the lease of the land if the power generation activity is decided to be stopped or if the land is used or proposed to be used for an activity other than for generation of power and other than for those connected or incidental to power generation. The decision will stop putting further Government money to run the power station, and to pave way for immediate NTPC's investment for its renovation and modernization activities. Unquote However, the company is yet to receive a formal communication from the Government of India in this regard.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that NTPC Ltd. has completed the sale of US$ 300 million of Notes on February 23, 2006. The Bond offering represents the first drawdown of NTPC Limited's new US$ 1 billion Medium Term Note Programme. The Notes, maturing in March 2016, were priced in London at 140 bps over the benchmark ten year US Treasury with a coupon of 5.875%. The Notes have been given ratings of BB+ from both Standard & Poor's Ratings Services and Fitch Ratings.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited had informed the Exchange regarding appointment of non-official part-time Directors (Independent Directors) on the Board of NTPC by the Government of India. The Company has now informed the Exchange that through resolutions passed by the Board of directors of the Company on February 15, 2006, the Audit Committee of NTPC has been reconstituted as under :- a) Joint Secretary & Financial Advisor, Ministry of Power represented on the Board of NTPC and b) Three non-official part-time Directors to be nominated by the Board from time to time. The Board of Directors has also nominated three Independent Directors on the Audit Committee. Reconstituted Audit Committee of NTPC comprises of following Directors :- i) Shri M. Sahoo, non-executive Director, ii) Dr. R. K. Pachuri, Independent Director, iii) Shri M. I. Beg, Independent Director and iv) Shri G. P. Gupta, Independent Director. Further, as decided by the Board of Directors of the Company senior most Independent Director on the Audit Committee shall be the Chairman of the Audit Committee.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous

NTPC's MTN Programme has obtained ratings of 'BB+' and 'BB+' respectively from Standard & Poor's and Fitch."

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited had informed the Exchange that the Government of India has taken an 'in-principle' decision to allocate the following coal blocks to NTPC / its Joint Venture with Coal India Limited: (1) Kerandari, North Karanpura (Coal Mine) - 228 MT (Capacity); (2) Chatti Bariatu, North Karanpura (Coal Mine) - 243 MT (Capacity); (3) Chattrasal, Singrauli (Coal Mine) - 150 MT (Capacity); (4) Dulanga, Ib Valley (Coal Mine) - 260 MT (Capacity); (5) Talaipalli (Coal Mine) - 965 MT (Capacity); (6) Brahmini (Coal Mine) - 1900 MT (Capacity). (7) Chichro Patsimal - (Coal Mine) - 356 MT (Capacity). The Company had further informed that no formal approval is available. The Company has now informed the Exchange that further to the communication of the 'in-principle' approval by the Government of India to allocate the seven coal blocks to NTPC / its Joint Venture with Coal India Limited, the Company has now received the formal approval of Ministry of Coal, Government of India. As per the communication now received, (i) Following coal mining blocks (out of the seven blocks) have been allocated for developing the same by a 50:50 joint venture formed between CIL and NTPC under the Ministry of Coal, Government of India : Brahmini (Coal Mine) - 1900 MT (Reserves). Chichro Patsimal (Coal Mine) - 356 MT.

The amount of interim dividend on 8,245,464,400 equity shares of Rs.10/- each works out to Rs.16,409.9 million.

The plant would be taken over by a new Joint Venture Company to be formed as a subsidiary of NTPC Limited with 51% Equity State of NTPC and BSEB taking the balance 49%.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange the following on the dispute with Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) regarding the Gas Sale & Purchase Agreement (GSPA) for sourcing Gas/LNG for its capacity addition of 1300 MW each at Kawas and Jhanore Gandhar, located in the state of Gujarat: "Since RIL has not agreed to sign the GSPA based on the terms agreed during the bid process and also not proceeded to perform the contract, NTPC has on December 20, 2005 filed a suit in the High Court of Judicature of Bombay with the prayer that Hon'ble Court directs RIL for specific performance of the GSPA. NTPC has also sought interim relief requesting the Hon'ble Court to direct RIL not to sale/commit/offer gas to any other customer without meeting its obligation to NTPC."

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange that the Government of India has taken an 'in-principle' decision to allocate the following coal blocks to NTPC / its Joint Venture with Coal India Limited: (1) Kerandari, North Karanpura (Coal Mine) - 228 MT (Capacity); (2) Chatti Bariatu, North Karanpura (Coal Mine) - 243 MT (Capacity); (3) Chattrasal, Singrauli (Coal Mine) - 150 MT (Capacity); (4) Dulanga, Ib Valley (Coal Mine) - 260 MT (Capacity); (5) Talaipalli (Coal Mine) - 965 MT (Capacity); (6) Brahmini (Coal Mine) - 1900 MT (Capacity). (7) Chichro Patsimal - (Coal Mine) - 356 MT (Capacity).  The Company has further informed that no formal approval is available.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: Ntpc Limited has informed the Exchange with reference to the news item "RIL-NTPC" row spells dark days for North" appearing in Economic Times dated December 07, 2005, In this regard following is informed to bring correct position and perspective: "(1) NTPC had followed a transparent international Competitive bidding process for sourcing GAS/LNG for its capacity addition of 1300 MW each at Kawas and Jhanore Gandhar, located in the state of Gujarat. (2) The draft terms and conditions of the Gas Sale & Purchase Agreement (GSPA) formed part of the Request for Proposal (RFP) document was issued to the qualified bidders short-listed through the qualification process (RFQ). (3)NTPC held protracted discussions with all the participating bidders wherein all the issues raised by bidders were discussed threadbare; where-after a set of amendments, on a non-discriminatory basis, was issued by NTPC, based on which a price bid was sought from the participating bidders. (4)RIL, accepted the terms & conditions of the GSPA, as amended and unconditionally withdrew all earlier deviations sought by it during the bid process and in its' final offer it increased the price of gas from its original offer. (5) The final offer of RIL was unconditionally accepted by NTPC and, accordingly, it is a legally binding and enforceable Contract. (6)Since RIL has sought changes in important terms, the Company is now considering taking legal recourse.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange regarding a News item "India awards exploration blocks to NTPC, Jubilant", which has come to the Company's notice and which is reproduced below: Quote: India has awarded two exploration blocks under the fifth round of the new Exploration Licensing Policy (NELP-V), Finance Minister Palaniappan Chidambaram told reporters. The government had earlier awarded 18 blocks under NELP-V but two blocks in Assam and Arunachal Pradesh states in north eastern India were held up because of some legal issues. One block was awarded to a consortium of Jubilant Oil and Gas Pvt. Ltd, Jubilant Securities Pvt. Ltd, Gujarat State Petroleum Corp and GAIL India Ltd. The other block, in Arunachal Pradesh, has been awarded to National Thermal Power Corp Ltd, Canoro Resources and GeoPetrol International. Reuters News. Unquote. In this regard, the Company has stated that they have not received any official communication on this subject and have no other information except having learnt it from the news items, copies of which shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements). The Company has further stated that the correct position will be informed to the Exchange as soon as the Company receives official communication about the award of Oil Block to NTPC Consortium.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the tenure of Shri C. P. Jain, Chairman & Managing Director has been extended by the Government of India till further orders. Shri Jain shall be attaining the age of superannuation i.e. 60 years on March 31, 2006.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the fourth 500 MW unit of Rihand Super Thermal Power Station has been commissioned and connected to the Northern Grid at 5 AM on September 24, 2005. With the commissioning of this unit the total installed capacity of Rihand Super Thermal Power Station is now 2000 MW.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has submitted to the Exchange a copy of the Chairman's Statement to be made at the AGM of the Company on September 23, 2005. It contains statements on company's future plans and strategies; major ones being: (i) In order to enhance its fuel security and mitigate fuel risk, the Company is going for coal mining and is also identifying coal pithead-based integrated power projects. Also, company has decided to participate in the entire value chain of Natural Gas / Liquefied Natural Gas covering exploration, equity stakes in gas fields, liquefaction terminals, transportation, re-gasification, etc. (ii) While the XI Plan target has been enhanced from 11,558 MW to 17,000 MW, the company plans to become a 66,000 MW Plus Company by the year 2017. Company plans to substantially increase the ratio of hydro projects in NTPC in order to achieve operational and commercial synergy. (iii) The company also has plans to acquire parallel distribution licenses in areas around its projects, while it is targeting to increase Power trading volume substantially. The company is engaged in the promotion of setting up a state-of -the-art National Power Exchange to facilitate power trading in the country. (iv) The Company is exploring possibilities to identify and initiate work on merchant power capacity. The entire statement shall also be hosted on NTPC's website.  The details of the Chairman's Statement shall be available on the NSE website Http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the auditor's have conducted the limited review of the unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2005 and the details of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Payment of Dividend
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited had informed the Exchange that the BODs in its meeting held on June 13, 2005 had recommended final dividend @ 12% on the face value of equity shares of Rs.10 each for the financial year 2004-05 subject to its approval by the shareholders at the AGM to be held on September 23, 2005. The date for payment of final dividend shall be September 27, 2005 to the eligible shareholders.

SUBJECT: Change in company's directorate
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that Dr. R.K. Pachauri, Director-General, The Energy and Resources Institute was appointed as Part-Time Non Official Director (Independent Director) on the Board of NTPC by the Government of India w.e.f. August 27, 2002 for a period of three years. Consequent upon expiry of tenure, Dr. R.K. Pachauri shall cease to be Director on the Board of NTPC w.e.f. August 26, 2005 (A/N).

SUBJECT: Book Closure/Others
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the Register of Members and Share Transfer Books of the Company will remain closed from September 10, 2005 to September 23, 2005 (both days inclusive).The dividend on equity shares,as recommended by the BODs,if declared at the AGM,will be paid on or after September 27,2005 to the members or their mandates,subject to the provisions of section 206A of the Companies Act,1956.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the 500 MW Unit - 3 at Rihand Super Thermal  Power Project will commence commercial operation on August 15, 2005. With the commercial operation of this unit, the total installed and commercial capacity of Rihand Super Thermal Power Project would be 1500 MW.

SUBJECT: Reg.13-SEBI(Prohibition of Insider Trading Regulations)1992
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that Shri A. K. Singhal, Director (Finance), of the Company holds 10829 shares as on August 01, 2005, i.e. the date of assuming office of Director. The mode of acquisition was Direct allotment in Public Issue.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the 500 MW Units at Talcher Super Thermal Power Station has commenced commercial operation on August 01, 2005. With the commercial operation of this unit, the total installed and commercial capacity of Talcher Super Thermal Power station is 3000 MW.

SUBJECT: Change in company's directorate
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that Shri P. Narasimharamulu, Director(Finance) has superannuated on July 31, 2005. Shri A.K. Singhal has taken over as Director (Finance) of the company w.e.f. August 01, 2005.

SUBJECT: Appointment
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that in pursuance of Article 41 of the Articles of Association of the company, the President of India has appointed Shri Harish Chandra, Joint Secretary, Ministry of Power as Part-time Director on the Board of NTPC w.e.f. July 11, 2005 in place of Shri Arvind Jadhav, Joint Secretary, Ministry of Power.

SUBJECT: Investment in equity shares
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of National Thermal Power Corporation Limited (NTPC) at its meeting held on July 09, 2005 has approved an investment of upto Rs.500 crore as share application money in the equity capital of Ratnagiri Gas and Power Private Limited (RGPL) - a 50:50 joint venture company (JVC) between NTPC and GAIL (India) Limited (GAIL), for taking over the assets of Dhabol Power Project by RGPL from Indian lenders to Dhabol Power Company through Debt Recovery Tribunal and Court process. The said investment decision is subject to (a) the approval by the Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs or relaxation of power granted by Government of India to NTPC for the purpose of acquisition of assets and investment in JVC; and (b) Investment approval of Rs.500 crore by the Board of Directors of GAIL in the equity of RGPL.

SUBJECT: Joint Venture
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that pursuant to the decision of the Government to restart Dabhol Power Project, Ratnagiri Gas and Power Private Limited has been incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956 on July 08, 2005 as an equal equity holding Joint Venture between National Thermal Power Corporation Limited and GAIL (India) Limited to take over the assets of Dabhol Power Project through Debt Recovery Tribunal.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that there have been some reports in the media regarding an adverse effect on the operations of coal-fired stations of the company due to non-availability of coal. The Company has further stated that while coal supply is an issue, to put the matter in proper perspective the company wishes to clarify that during the first quarter of the current FY i.e. April 01, 2005 to June 30, 2005 coal-fired stations of the company generated 35431 million units (MUs) as against 33124 MUs generated in the same quarter in the previous year thus registering an increase of 6.96%. Further, the Plant Load Factor (PLF) for coal-based stations of the company for the quarter ended June 30, 2005 improved to 87.31% as compared to 87.13% during the same period in the previous FY. The Company has further informed that the operational performance of the gas stations have also registered an improvement. During the quarter ended on June 30, 2005 gas stations generated 5974 MUs as against 5741 MUs in the same quarter in the previous quarter registering an increase of 4.06%. The PLF of gas stations of the company for the quarter ended June 30, 2005 was 68.09% as against 65.43% for the same quarter in the previous year.

SUBJECT: Resignation
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that cosequent upon acceptance of his resignation by the Government of India, Shri K.K. Sinha, Director (HR) has relinquished the charge of his post in NTPC with effect from June 27, 2005.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that in line with its expansion plans, the Company has decided the following:  1.To submit a proposal to the Government of Srilanka to set up a 900 MW Coal/LNG based Power Project in Srilanka on Build, Own, Operate (BOO) / Build, Own, Operate and Transfer (BOOT) basis.  2.To enter into an MOU with Government of Bihar and Bihar State Electricity Board for transfer of Muzzaffarpur Thermal Power Station, 2 X 110 MW at Kanti, District Muzaffarpur in Bihar to the proposed Joint Venture Company of NTPC and BSEB.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that pursuant to the decision of the Government to restart Dabhol Power Project, formalities for formation of a Project Special Purpose Vehicle with equal equity participation of NTPC and GAIL have been initiated. This SPV is being formed for taking over the assets of Dabhol Power Company through Debt Recovery Tribunal.

SUBJECT: Dividend
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the BODs in their meeting held on June 13, 2005 have recommended final dividend of 12% of paid up equity share capital in addition to the interim dividend paid @ 12% of paid up equity share capital in March 2005.

SUBJECT: Notice of  Meeting
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that a meeting of the Audit Committee of the Company is schedulded to be held on June 13, 2005, inter alia to review the Annual Accounts of the Company for the year ending March 31, 2005 before submission to the Board of Directors of the Company.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the company has published an 'Investor Handbook'. A copy of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Results of Postal Ballot
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has submitted to the Exchange a copy of the resolution passed by way of postal ballot by the shareholders of the Company. The resolution has the effect of amending existing clause 4 of Memorandum of Association of the Company to 4(a) and 4(b). A copy of the resolution shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange regarding the following: "National Thermal Power Corporation Ltd. (NTPC) and Defence Metallurgical Research Laboratory (DMRL) have signed an MOU. As per the MOU, NTPC will provide technical and logistical support for the development of gas turbine blades and DMRL will be responsible for development of casting, hipping and heat treatment. NTPC will develop the specifications and would take care of mechanical testing of components at site. This project shall make available source of supply of critical equipment indigenously and also save foreign exchange."

SUBJECT: Reg.13-SEBI(Prohibition of Insider Trading Regulations)1992
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that Shri R.K. Jain, Director(Technical), of the Company holds 369 shares as  on May 05, 2005 i.e. the date of his assuming office of Director.The mode of acquisition was direct allotment in public issue.

SUBJECT: Appointment of Directors
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that Mr. R.K. Jain has been appointed as Director (Technical) of the National Thermal Corporation Limited w.e.f. May 05, 2005. He joined NTPC in the year 1977 and has served in various capacities within the company. Prior to his current elevation he was Executive Director in-charge of National Capital Region of the company.

SUBJECT: Postal Ballot
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that as per Section 192A of the Companies Act 1956, the Company is seeking the shareholders' consent on the draft Special Resolution for amendment in object clause of its Memorandum of Association (MOA) by bifurcating the existing clause 4 of MOA into two separate sub-clause in a more enlarged and explicit manner for undertaking diversified range of fuel related activities as set out in the resolution. The Company has appointed Ms. Madhurima Mukherjee, Senior Associate, M/s. Amarchand & Mangaldas & Suresh a. Shroff & Co., as Scrutinizer for conducting the postal ballot process. The duly completed postal ballot form should reach the Scrutinizer on or before the close of working hours on May 23, 2005 and the results of Postal Ballot will be declared by the Chairman & Managing Director on May 26, 2005.  The details of the postal ballot notice shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that NTPC Hydro Ltd., a wholly owned subsidiary of NTPC and West Bengal State Electricity Board have signed an agreement to take up implementation of Ramam Stage-III (90MW) Hydro-Electric Power Project on river Ramam in the State of West Bengal as run of the river scheme. This project shall be commissioned during 11th plan period.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the Chairman & Managing Director of the Company would be holding a press conference on April 08, 2005, in New Delhi. The performance highlights including provisional unaudited Profit after Tax and Turnover of NTPC for the financial year 2004-05 would be shared with the press. A copy of the Highlights which would be circulated to press shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Resignation
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that "Shri K K Sinha, Director (Human Resources) NTPC has submitted his resignation on personal grounds and the same has been forwarded to Ministry of Power, Government of India for acceptance."

SUBJECT: Commencement of commercial operation
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the 500 MW unit at Ramagundam Super Thermal Power Station has commenced commercial operation on March 25, 2005. With the commercial operation of this unit the total installed and commercial capacity of Ramagundam Super Thermal Power Project is 2600 MW.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the BODs of the company at their meeting held on February 21,2005 have approved the investment proposal for Barh Super Thermal Power Project(3*660 MW) at current cost of Rs.8692.97 crore(Rs.4887.12 crore + USD 864.96 million, where 1 USD =Rs.44.00).The first unit is expected to be synchronized within 48 months from the placement of Main Plant Order and subsequent units at an interval of 10 months each thereafter.

SUBJECT: Change in company's directorate
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that Prof. Ashok Misra, Director, IIT, Powai, Mumbai was appointed as Part-Time Non Official Director (Independent Director) on the Board of NTPC by the Government of India w.e.f. February 08, 2002 for a period of three years. Consequent upon expiry of tenure, Prof. Ashok Misra has ceased to be Director on the Board of NTPC w.e.f. February 07, 2005 (A/N).

SUBJECT: Payment of Dividend
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the BOD's in its meeting held on February 12, 2005 had decided inter-alia to pay interim dividend for the financial year 2004-05. The interim dividend shall be paid @12% on the face value of paid up equity shares of Rs.10/- each. The date for payment of interim dividend shall be March 10, 2005 to the eligible shareholders.

SUBJECT: Interim Dividend/Record Date
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the BODs in its meeting held on February 12,2005 has decided, inter-alia,to pay Interim Dividend for the Financial year 2004-05.The interim dividend shall be paid at the rate of 12% on the face value of paid up equity share of Rs.10/- each.The record date for determining the shareholders eligible for receipt of interim dividend shall be February 28,2005.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that pursuant to the approval by NTPC BODs, the name of Kayamkulam Combined Cycle Power Project located at Kayamkulam in Allappuzha district of Kerala has been changed to Rajiv Gandhi Combined Cycle Power Project.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that Unit IV (500 MW) of Talcher Super Thermal Power Project-Stage II(TSTPP-II) of National Thermal Power Corporation(NTPC) has been successfully synchronized on February 06,2005.The Unit IV of TSTPP Stage II has been commissioned twelve(12) months ahead of schedule.The Unit IV was  scheduled for commissioning in Feb 2006. With the commissioning of this unit,TSTPP-Stage II(4*500 MW) has been completed and the installed capacity of Talcher Super Thermal Power Project has become 3000 MW.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the company has approved an investment of an estimated cost of Rs.229.24 crore to undertake Renovation & Modernisation (R&M) Phase-III of Talcher Thermal Power Station. The investment is proposed to be funded in a debt equity ratio of 50:50.The R&M Phase-III is proposed to be completed by March 2008.

SUBJECT: Clarification of News
DETAILS: Clarification of News : The press had reports on January 26, 2005 that National Thermal Power Corporation Limited is in talks with Nuclear Power Corporation of India for possibilities of entering into nuclear power business. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the press and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "NTPC has no plans for nuclear capacity creation during X and XI five year plans i.e. upto 2012. However, with a view to examine its long term options for capacity addition, NTPC has had some preliminary discussions with officials of Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited to understand issues involved in nuclear power generation and explore the possibilities for future cooperation between the two organizations".

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the Management of the Company has decided to supply Ash directly to end users on no profit no loss basis.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the company had proposed to add 9370 MW in the X Plan and 11558 MW in the XI Plan earlier. The company is now considering to enhance its capacity addition programme for the XI Plan from 11558 MW to over 17000 MW and has revised the X Plan capacity addition target to 9160 MW. The details of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange of the following: "The III 500 MW unit of Rihand Super Thermal Power Project (Stage-II: 2X500MW) of NTPC has been successfully synchronized eight months ahead of schedule. The unit was scheduled for commissioning in August 2005.The contract for construction of project was awarded on August 14,2001 and excavation work for the foundation and fabrication work started in December 2001. All major milestones of the third unit were completed either on or ahead of schedule such as boiler drum lifting in March 2003,hydro test of the boiler in January 2004 and boiler light up in September 2004. During the construction of unit-III, many records were achieved such as concreting of TG raft in 54 hours, boiler foundation in 9 days and highest erection of 2071 MT in a single month in a boiler. With the commissioning of the III unit the installed capacity of the project will be enhanced from 1000 MW to 1500 MW. Significant progress has also been made in construction of the IV Unit of 5000 MW.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange of the following plans: 1)The company proposes to import coal to meet the shortfall in Coal availability at some NTPC stations. 2)The company also plans a backward integration in regard to LNG.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange of the following: "As per the borrowing programme to meet the capital expenditure requirement during 2004-05, NTPC will borrow Rs.1000 crore from LIC during January-March 2005. Out of this, the borrowing to the extent of Rs.500 crore will be made in the form of Term Loan and Rs.500 crore in the form of issuance of Bonds by way of private placement."

SUBJECT: Clarification of News
DETAILS: Clarification of News : The press had reports on January 26, 2005 that National Thermal Power Corporation Limited is in talks with Nuclear Power Corporation of India for possibilities of entering into nuclear power business. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the press and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Reply is awaited from National Thermal Power Corporation Limited.

SUBJECT: Limited Review Report
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that the Auditor's have conducted the limited review for the un-audited financial results for the half year ended September 30, 2004 and the details of the same are available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that one of the whole-time directors of the Company proposes to publish an article captioned "NTPC & Power Scenario" in "The Hindu - Survey of Industry 2005". The matters covered in the aforementioned article are available in the public domain, with the exception of the information w.r.t. "Corporate Transformation for realizing the Vision". Therefore, in line with the Corporate Disclosure requirements, the Company has informed of the following: "Corporate Transformation for realizing the Vision - Most of the activities an initiatives being taken up today are in fulfillment of the future Vision of NTPC. To create the organization of the future, it is helpful to not only bring about improvements in various facets but also attempt a total transformation of the entire organization process and functions along with questioning the very fundamentals. With a view to fulfill its long-term Vision, NTPC has begun to implement a Corporate Transformation Programme called 'DISHA' with the help of the international Consultant."

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange regarding certain issues relating to NTPC's plans: 1)NTPC is in the process of negotiating a loan upto USD 45 million from the Swedish Export Credit Agency to part finance Sipat II project. The detailed terms and conditions of the loans would be intimated as and when they are finalized. 2)The Budget Estimates for the year 2005-06 envisage a capital outlay of Rs.8550 crs. The capital expenditure would be financed in the Debt:Equity Ratio of 70:30. 3)NTPC is exploring the availability of gas in countries abroad and the possibility of importing it in liquefied form(LNG) and then to re-gassify and use it in NTPC gas stations to augment existing gas supplies.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: National Thermal Power Corporation Limited has informed the Exchange that customarily on the eve of each new Year, the Chairman and Managing Director of the company addresses all the employees through a communication regarding the achievements of the company in the year gone and also about future plans of the company. Since the company has now made an equity issue and has a large number of shareholders who are also employees, a communication on the same lines is also being made to all the shareholders vide a letter dated January 01,2005.However, instead of sending the communication individually to all the shareholders the company proposes to host the same on the company's website on December 31,2004.A copy of the communication shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).
